title: Warren and Sanders Want to Tax the Wealthy. That Won’t Fix Everything.
text:
The idea that the wealthy should pay more in tax isn’t new. But it has certainly become one of the main focuses in the 2020 election.

Throughout their campaigns, Sens. Elizabeth Warren from Massachusetts and Bernie Sanders from Vermont each have proposed taxing the estates of the ultra-rich, a plan that has received public support. There are good reasons why people think the idea is justifiable: Over the past three decades, the wealth of the top 1% rich households have been growing at an annual rate of nearly 5%, while the...
description: Despite the staggering amount of money that could be raised, both plans won’t solve fiscal problems in the U.S. because the tax would have to be applied more widely to raise enough revenue, a Bernstein economist says.
